data.title: Re-implemented texture action for scene import
data.body:
Removed dud "Shared" option and added option to import textures to the same folder as the source, or to just use them without importing (flags may need to be applied manually).

I did this so that I can have blender models and textures living directly within the project tree, simplifying my asset pipeline.

Preview of the UI change:
![screenshot_2017-01-25_00-07-45](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/185322/22255480/735e9036-e292-11e6-8531-b4e3da1539b7.png)

data.title: Fix resources for Android modules not being merged (2.1)
data.body: Fixes #7421.

data.title: Sprite frame textbox arrows and slider dont work
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.1 - Windows 10

**Issue description:**
The up/down arrows next to "Frame" on a sprite node don't work. The slider that appears when you select its textbox doesn't work either.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a scene containing only a 2d sprite node
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5151242/22241804/227d5962-e275-11e6-9f5d-42b934f10e03.png)

Load in any spritespritesheet on the Sprite Node for its texture (I used a png file)
Set "Hframes" and/or "Vframes" to some value (eg. 2 Hframes, 2 Vframes)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5151242/22241821/30cd7592-e275-11e6-9ebd-3a01f77d942b.png)


Error 1) In the "frame" textbox type a number and hit enter. The sprite on screen will change, but the textbox still says that you're on frame "0"
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5151242/22241835/3af91a1c-e275-11e6-8aae-b0692b6817e8.png)

Error 2) If you click the up and down arrows as part of the sprite textbox, they don't change the sprite frame
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5151242/22241898/6aaa2328-e275-11e6-8ece-33d3c337813f.png)

Error 3) If you click the frame textbox, it pops up a slider for changing the frame, but the slider is missing the handle to grab to change frames.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5151242/22241944/95f7b25c-e275-11e6-9e15-b752a6e32932.png)

data.title: Linux editor 3d clip distance + fov settings not working
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04
godot 2.2 + 2.1

**Issue description:**
Changing the fov or the clip distances in the editor do not work under linux. Looks fine under windows...


**Steps to reproduce:**
Make a 2kmx2km scene in blender. import. Try changing the clip planes or fov. They dont update...

data.title: WindowDialogs shown with popup() do not emit mouse_exited correctly
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3.0 built from master

**Issue description:**
The `mouse_exited` signal is erroneously not emitted in the following case:
- A WindowDialog has been shown with `popup()` (`exclusive` doesn't matter) and the mouse pointer has entered this one.
- The pointer leaves the area of the dialog, but still hovers over another control.

The signal for the `WindowDialog` gets emitted as soon as the pointer moves to an empty area with no control under it - not only "too late" but also when it actually left a totally different control rather than the `WindowDialog`.

This sounds similar to https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2710, but it only happens with `WindowDialog` nodes.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Testing it with my resizable dialogs it becomes even more visible: The cursor doesn't change back, even though it should change it `CURSOR_ARROW` on exiting the window.
![example](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9631152/22223959/2be3492a-e1bd-11e6-80bc-28b225300d21.gif)

**Link to minimal example project:**
Click on "Show WindowDialog" and watch the output.
[buggy_mouse_exit.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/725015/buggy_mouse_exit.zip)

data.title: Add ClassDB binding for File.get_modified_time
data.body: Closes #7613

data.title: Richtextlabel meta links shouldn't open when swiping to scroll
data.body:
**Version and use case**

I'm using Godot 2.1.1 to make an Android app. The app displays a long text with a lot of meta links.

**Description**

Scrolling a Richtextlabel on Android is done with swiping, but if the initial position that you put your finger to swipe is a meta link then the meta link will be opened.

If a large percentage of the Richtextlabel area is meta links, then it's uncomfortable to scroll.

I think a meta link should only be activated on release of the press or click.

Additionally, on Android to access the home button in a fullscreen program you have to swipe from the top of the screen downward. This swiping motion also causes the Richtextlabel to scroll if your finger goes over it. I don't think that that should happen.

If I run it straight from the project manager, it opens up, but the character is not moving.
If I click edit and then run, it gives an error in the console. The debugger says - Invalid call. Nonexistent function 'move_and_slide' in base 'KinematicBody2D (player.gd)'.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1.Download the example projects.
2.Import the "Platformer" project
3.Click edit
4.Run the stage.tscn scene

**Link to minimal example project:**
<!-- Optional but very welcome. You can drag and drop a zip archive to upload it. -->:

data.title: Separate signal-waiting from coroutine calls
data.body:
It doesn't make sense for coroutines to both be able to yield to their caller and "yield" to a signal; there should be one thing that has control of the coroutine. I am pretty sure there isn't any use case for using both in the same method, but maybe someone can come up with one. Currently there can't be one, since yielding to a signal doesn't work when the yielding method is called from another method, but maybe there could be some way to use it if that limitation was fixed somehow.

There should be one method for signal-waiting, and another one for yielding as a coroutine. If these are separated, the yield (for coroutines) should be able to pass a value to the calling resume/original call somehow, to request things from the caller.

data.title: Separate coroutine calls from function calls
data.body:
Currently you can't factor out any code with a yield() into a separate function, because yields only yield up to the next function call. For example:
```
func retrieve_burrito():
    initiate_burrito_search()
    return yield(self, "burrito_acquisition")
```
will not work.

I propose a function of some kind `make_coroutine` which calling as `make_coroutine(obj, "method", args...)` creates a new coroutine state as if the method had yielded at the very beginning.

To make the next part easier to state, call any resume from a coroutine state created by this method a "coroutine call".

Whenever a function yields, instead of immediately returning from the function it yielded in, it will cause the innermost coroutine call containing the yield to return. If it is not contained within any coroutine call, it will cause the current function to return like yield currently behaves.

data.title: No warning when pressing "Remove Animation"
data.body:
Godot 2.1.1 stable

When pressing the little trashcan "Remove Animation" in the Animation dock, it deletes selected animation without warning. It is too easy to accidentally remove an animation with hours put into it.

I know it is possible to save the animation as a file, but I think it would be great to have a "Are you sure?" warning, as deleting an animation by accident can be quiet a loss.

data.title: Export templates for Android not working
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
OS X 10.11.6 - Godot 2.1.2 - Export Templates 2.1.2

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
Moving to 2.1.2 broke the Android ARMv7 export template. App is stuck on Godot splashscreen and keeps flickering. And attaching the debugger shows ...
`W/GodotView( 9646): creating OpenGL ES 2.0 context :`

crash reports like this:
```
W/ActivityManager(  743):   Force finishing activity 1 org.godotengine.bubblepresent/org.godotengine.godot.Godot
E/JavaBinder(  743): !!! FAILED BINDER TRANSACTION !!!

W/ActivityManager(  743): android.os.TransactionTooLargeException
W/ActivityManager(  743): 	at android.os.BinderProxy.transactNative(Native Method)
W/ActivityManager(  743): 	at android.os.BinderProxy.transact(Binder.java:496)
W/ActivityManager(  743): 	at android.app.ApplicationThreadProxy.schedulePauseActivity(ApplicationThreadNative.java:932)
W/ActivityManager(  743): 	at com.android.server.am.ActivityStack.startPausingLocked(ActivityStack.java:1335)
```

data.title: I want File.get_mtime(filename)
data.body:
<!--
README: Incompatibilities and broken features in the current master branch / 3.0-alpha
are known and expected due to important refactoring work, so no need to report them for now. Thanks!
-->

**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
I need get a modify time of file. Like unix stat.st_mtime

**Feature request**
Need get a modify time of file.
Found `File::get_modify_time()` in Godot sources. It good. But need same in gdScript.

Want gd-function:

    /**
    * get_mtime(filename)
    * @filename: String  Full path to file
    * @return: int  File modification time. In seconds since 01.01.1970. 
    */
    Int File.get_mtime(String filename)

Usage:

    var mtime = File.get_mtime(filename)

It would be nice...

data.title: Support touch screen actions on desktop platforms
data.body:
On many laptops, touch screens are now available. However, it isn't possible to scroll by flicking the scrollable area up and down in the Godot editor (in the script editor or scene tree, for example), like you can do on a mobile device. You currently need to drag the scroll bar, which can be very hard to do.

This ability could also be helpful in exported projects.

Exemple application which supports touch events: [Visual Studio Code](http://code.visualstudio.com/)

CollisionShape2D: Fix warning icon not updating.
data.body:
`CollisionPolygon2D` also had this problem.
Fixes #7609

data.title: Issues with warning icon on CollisionShape2D nodes
data.body:
Issue when adding a shape to a CollisionShape2D node :
 When adding a CollisionShape2D to a RigidBody2D, the CollisionShape node gets a warning exclaimation mark next to it. Clicking the warning icon pops up a "Node Configuration Warning : A shape must be provided for CollisionShape2D to function. Please create a shape resource for it!" window.
If you now select the collision node and define a shape for it (eg. "New RectangleShape2d") the warning icon does not disappear like it should. Clicking it now does nothing.

Issue when removing a shape from a CollisionShape2D node :
I can get the icon to disappear, either by reloading the scene, or by dragging the node onto another parent, then dragging it back on the RigidBody2D node. If I now "clear" the shape, the warning icon does not reappear like it should. I can get it to reappear by reparenting the CollisionShape node, but the warning icon should appear as soon as the error condition is met (ie. when the node no longer has an associated shape).

Version 2.1.1

data.title: Does not build with VC++ due to missing _USE_MATH_DEFINES
data.body:
`eq.cpp`, `reverb.cpp` and `audio_effect_distortion.cpp` all use the constants `M_SQRT2` or `M_PI`.

Those constants are not included with `maths.h` in VC++ while `_USE_MATH_DEFINES` is not defined, making it impossible to build **master** for me (VS2015) at the moment.

I would've fixed the build but don't know where and how exactly.

data.title: Dart Language Binding
data.body:
Check out this video: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iPlPk43RbpA

I think Dart would make a great language for binding to Godot in addition to C#.  Hot Reloading of anything and everything could be a killer feature of Godot.  Thoughts?

data.title: Constant frame flickering after window is maximized/minimized
data.body:
Godot 2.1.1, Windows 10, 64 bits
nVidia 940M

When maximize or minimize the game window with a double-click or drag to top, 90% of the time the game starts to violently jitter, as if double-buffering was not working correctly. With a moving camera the effect becomes almost epileptic.
The only way to get rid of it is to resize the window multiple times until it eventually goes away next time it is maximized. It happens with any Godot game and is noticeable when anything moves on screen.

It's been a long time around, I mentionned the problem in another issue https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2043#issuecomment-254009898 but I felt it was a different matter than the one discussed in the beginning, so I made a new issue.

Here is a video showing the jittering, here happening on minimize:
http://zylannprods.fr/lab/godot/videos/stuttering_motion_example.mp4

I am surprised it wasn't mentionned before, maybe I'm the only guy who makes a resizeable game :p

data.title: Respect style boxes for Button states other than "normal"
data.body:
Fixes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/7570

Previously, only the "normal" state `Button` style box had an effect on the content alignment in the button. I made it respect whichever state is current and the one used to draw the background.

data.title: Testing SamplePlayer latency on all platforms
data.body:
As discussed in #6965 and in great part fixed in #7425 by @lonesurvivor, SamplePlayer before 2.1.2 and 3.0 used to have a big latency (~200 ms) due to a bad initialisation of the audio drivers.

We should try to ensure that all drivers now behave properly, so this new issue can serve to gather feedback about all platforms/drivers to identify those that might still need a fix. If someone can make a test project that can be used to benchmark the latency, that would be great too :)

Platforms/drivers to check:

- [ ] Linux / [PulseAudio](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/drivers/pulseaudio/audio_driver_pulseaudio.cpp) (should be fixed by #7425, confirmation welcome)
- [ ] Linux / [Alsa](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/drivers/alsa/audio_driver_alsa.cpp) (should be fixed by #7425, confirmation welcome)
- [ ] Windows / [RtAudio](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/drivers/rtaudio/audio_driver_rtaudio.cpp) (should be fixed by #7425, confirmation welcome)
- [ ] OSX / [OSX](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/osx/audio_driver_osx.cpp)
- [ ] UWP / [Xaudio2](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/drivers/xaudio2/audio_driver_xaudio2.cpp)
- [ ] Android / [OpenSL](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/android/audio_driver_opensl.cpp)
- [ ] Android / [JAndroid](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/android/audio_driver_jandroid.cpp) -- disabled, so probably not worth bothering with
- [ ] iPhone / [iPhone](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/iphone/audio_driver_iphone.cpp)
- [ ] JavaScript / [JavaScript](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/javascript/audio_driver_javascript.cpp)
- [ ] Haiku / [Media Kit](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/haiku/audio_driver_media_kit.cpp)
- [ ] BB10 / [BB10](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/blob/master/platform/bb10/audio_driver_bb10.cpp)

Testing can be done with the official 2.1.2 binaries as they contain the fix from #7425, and that branch is arguably easier to test than the master branch with a disabled audio engine right now :p

Of course platforms like Haiku or BB10 are not strongly maintained, so if we can't check/fix them, it's not a huge problem :)

data.title: Zero padding and the sign have the wrong order in string formatting
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 7, 

**Issue description:**
The zero padding together with signs behave different than I'm use to. The zero's are added before the sign of the number. So while I would expect the code below to print
+01
-02
-03
it actually prints:
0+1
0-2
0-3

I'd say this is undesirable behaviour.

**Steps to reproduce:**
```
func _ready():
	print("%+03d" % 1)
	print("%+03d" % -2)
	print("%03d" % -3)
```

data.title: Fix several drawing and logic issues in TabContainer
data.body:
Tabs in `TabContainer` were drawn incorrectly and clicking the navigation buttons had no effect. This issue was probably introduced in an effort to allow tab alignment for https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/2207

- Fixes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/7546: Navigation buttons left / right did not work.
- Fixes https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6997: Navigation buttons were drawn outside of the control.
- Tabs were drawn outside of the available area and incorrectly aligned.
- Navigation buttons were drawn above tabs, making it impossible to use them.

Beyond rewriting the drawing and GUI logic which was required because the previous code was patchwork, I also changed the method of retrieving all the nodes which are handled as tabs (this does not include non-`Control` children and toplevel ones). Most methods reimplemented iterating through the children and checking the controls, now the method `_get_tabs()` is used in each.

- Fixes a bug that caused `get_tab_count()` to return a wrong number of tabs as it did not check for toplevel controls.

data.title: Wildcards in function arguments
data.body:
Given that we now have `TK_WILDCARD` in GDScript, and _ is officially banned as a variable ( @karroffel  ), I would like to request to be able to write this:
```gdscript
func handler(_, _):
  pass # Might actually complete this write one day
```
Instead of:
```gdscript
func handler(discard = null, discard2 = null):
  pass # Might actually complete this write one day
```

data.title: Break out gdscript module
data.body:
The sort of scripting language isolation that you have in Godot's architecture is quite unique, and _very_ exciting! I have a suggestion to capitalize on it and make it even better. I don't think it's a huge change, but I am definitely interested in hearing your thoughts. I absolutely love a lot of parts about Godot, such as the amazing interoperability between making C++ modules, and using them in Godot and gdscript. I honestly believe that with a bit of work, this could be yet another part that hardcore users fall in love with. 

I think it would be a great idea to break out `modules/gdscript` into a separate repo, and any other possible parts of supporting gdscript in this repo. Especially with the work on supporting C#, this would make a clear separation between language bindings and the core engine and editor.

I know you guys don't want to support a bunch of languages, and I don't blame you! I think doing this would facilitate the community to work on their own bindings if they want them, which you should not be bogged down by supporting in any way. For example, all the people complaining about supporting "X language" (JS, Rust, C#, etc.) could actually even more feasibly add support themselves, or start up a community effort. The less work you guys have to do, the better.

Admittedly I was one of those people complaining, as I would like to use a language with an established ecosystem that extends far outside of gamedev, such as JavaScript with all the packages on npm. My current understanding is that if I work really hard at it I can make this happen already, but I think breaking out gdscript would make the path even more clear.

data.title: LightOccluder2D transparency.
data.body:
I'm developing a 2D game in which LightOccluder2D node is a great help but some of my objects should be semi-transparent. I think it would be nice if there was a parameter in LightOccluder2D which would affect how "bright" shadow behind it will be. Right now all shadows are the same color based on the settings in Light2D.

I'm not sure if this feature is possible to make with GLES 3.0, but I hope it is.
